item.title: Hello World
item.description: Hello world Go Go is simple, concise and to the point. It is extremely clean and is performant enough. TL;DR: Go is awesome import "fmt" func main(){ fmt.Println("Hello World!") } Python Indents are stupid There are numerous ways to write a helloworld in python. I hate python’s syntax, but everything in machine learning is being done in it, so here goes nothing print("The syntax is stupid, but the language is fun nonetheless") C Ahh, C.
item.content:
Hello world

Go

Go is simple, concise and to the point. It is extremely clean and is performant enough. TL;DR: Go is awesome

import "fmt"
func main(){
fmt.Println("Hello World!")
}

Python

Indents are stupid

There are numerous ways to write a helloworld in python. I hate python’s syntax, but everything in machine learning is being done in it, so here goes nothing

print("The syntax is stupid, but the language is fun nonetheless")

C

Ahh, C. I love it.

#include <stdio.h>

int main(){
printf("Ol' but gold\n");
return 0;
}
